applications.name: Gmail
applications.description: Gmail is Google's web-based email service with features for composing, organizing, and searching emails. It includes extensive keyboard shortcuts and screen reader support for accessible email management.

shortcuts.description: Press G then I to navigate to the Inbox view showing all incoming messages.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Inbox opened and message count. Quick way to return to main inbox.

shortcuts.description: Press G then S to navigate to Starred messages view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Starred view and count of starred messages.

shortcuts.description: Press G then T to navigate to Sent mail folder showing messages you've sent.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Sent mail view with message count.

shortcuts.description: Press G then D to navigate to Drafts folder showing unsent composed messages.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Drafts view and count of draft messages.

shortcuts.description: Press G then A to navigate to All Mail view showing all messages except trash and spam.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce All Mail view. Includes archived messages.

variants.keys: J for newer, K for older
J for newer, K for older

shortcuts.description: Press J to move to newer conversation or K to move to older conversation in the list.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce conversation subject, sender, and date as you navigate.

shortcuts.description: Press O or Enter to open the selected conversation to read its messages.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce conversation opened and read first message sender and subject.

shortcuts.description: Press U to return to the conversation list from an open message.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce conversation list and focus on previously selected conversation.

shortcuts.context: When viewing conversation with multiple messages
shortcuts.description: Press N to jump to the next message within the current conversation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce next message sender and content.

shortcuts.description: Press P to jump to the previous message within the current conversation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous message details.

shortcuts.description: Press C to open a new compose window for writing a new email message.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce compose window opened. Focus placed in To field for entering recipients.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and C together to open compose in a new browser window instead of overlay.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce compose window opened in new window.

shortcuts.description: Press R to reply to the sender of the currently displayed message.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce reply window opened. Focus in message body for typing reply.

shortcuts.context: When viewing message with multiple recipients
shortcuts.description: Press A to reply to all recipients included in the conversation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce reply all window opened with all recipients.

shortcuts.description: Press F to forward the current message to other recipients.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce forward window opened. Add recipients and additional message.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Enter together to send the message you're currently composing.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce message sent. Compose window closes automatically.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and C together to show CC field for carbon copy recipients.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce CC field visible. Focus moves to CC field.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and B together to show BCC field for blind carbon copy recipients.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce BCC field visible. Focus moves to BCC field.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and K together to insert a hyperlink in the message body.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce link dialog. Enter URL and link text.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and D together to discard current draft and close compose window.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce draft discarded. Message is not saved.

shortcuts.description: Press E to archive selected conversation removing it from inbox while keeping in All Mail.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce conversation archived. Message preserved but removed from inbox.

shortcuts.description: Press Hash key to move selected conversation to Trash.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce conversation moved to trash. Can be restored within 30 days.

shortcuts.description: Press Exclamation mark to report selected conversation as spam and move to Spam folder.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce message reported as spam. Helps Gmail filter future similar messages.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and I together to mark selected conversations as read.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce messages marked as read. Removes bold highlighting.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and U together to mark selected conversations as unread for later attention.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce messages marked as unread. Appears bold to indicate unread status.

shortcuts.description: Press S to add or remove star from selected conversation for quick reference.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce conversation starred or unstarred. Starred messages easily accessible.

shortcuts.description: Press M to mute conversation so future replies automatically archive and skip inbox.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce conversation muted. Useful for busy threads you don't need to follow.

shortcuts.description: Press B to snooze conversation which hides it until a specified time when it reappears in inbox.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce snooze dialog. Select time for message to return to inbox.

shortcuts.description: Press L to open label menu for adding labels to selected conversations for organization.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce label menu. Type to search labels or navigate with arrows.

shortcuts.description: Press V to move selected conversations to a different folder or label.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce move menu. Select destination folder.

shortcuts.description: Press X to select or deselect the focused conversation for batch operations.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce conversation selected or deselected. Build multi-selection.

shortcuts.description: Press Asterisk then R to select all read conversations in current view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce read conversations selected. Useful for bulk archiving.

shortcuts.description: Press Asterisk then N to clear all selections.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce selection cleared.

shortcuts.description: Press Asterisk then U to select all unread conversations in current view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce unread conversations selected.

shortcuts.description: Press Asterisk then S to select all starred conversations in current view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce starred conversations selected.

shortcuts.description: Press Forward Slash to place focus in search box for searching emails.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce search box focused. Type keywords to search messages.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and B together to make selected text bold in message body.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce bold formatting applied.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and I together to italicize selected text in message body.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce italic formatting.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and U together to underline selected text in message body.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce underline formatting.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 7 together to create numbered list in message body.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce numbered list created.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 8 together to create bulleted list in message body.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bulleted list created.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Z together to undo last editing action in message compose.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce undo action.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Y together to redo previously undone action.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce redo action.

shortcuts.description: Press Question Mark to open keyboard shortcuts help showing all available shortcuts.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce shortcuts help dialog. Shows complete list of Gmail shortcuts.

shortcuts.description: Press Plus Sign to mark selected conversation as important for Gmail priority inbox.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce conversation marked as important.

shortcuts.description: Press Minus Sign to mark conversation as not important for priority filtering.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce conversation marked as not important.

shortcuts.description: Press G then B to view only conversations with attachments.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce filtered view showing messages with attachments.

shortcuts.description: Press G then K to open Google Tasks side panel for managing tasks.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Tasks panel opened.

shortcuts.description: Press G then C to open Google Contacts in new tab.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Contacts opening in new tab.

shortcuts.description: Press Semicolon to expand all collapsed messages in the current conversation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce all messages expanded. Shows full conversation thread.

shortcuts.description: Press Colon to collapse all messages in the current conversation showing only most recent.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce messages collapsed.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and P together to print the current message or conversation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce print dialog opened.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and O together to view original message source including headers.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce original message view. Shows raw email with all technical headers.

shortcuts.keys: Question Mark, then Screen reader on

variants.keys: ? to open help, enable in settings
? to open help, enable in settings

shortcuts.description: Enable screen reader support in Gmail settings for optimized keyboard navigation and announcements.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce optimized mode enabled. Improves navigation and ARIA announcements. Access via Settings > General > Keyboard shortcuts.

shortcuts.description: Press Comma then N to jump focus to left navigation panel with folders and labels.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce navigation panel focused. Navigate folders with arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Comma then S to jump focus to search box.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce search box focused.
